info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 10:46PM EST until December 27 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following areas, Burke Mountains, Caldwell Mountains, Greater Burke and Greater Caldwell. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep moisture across the area and southerly low level flow will support the potential for additional rainfall into the early morning hours. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches have fallen across the Watch area and an additional half inch is possible. This could lead to additional flooding or a return to flooding along streams where water continues to run high. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
